details.title: Trinamool Congress, BJP in silent mode ahead of verdict
details.content:
As the state witnessed a month-long fierce electoral battle, both the TMC and the saffron camp claimed on Saturday that they would secure majority in two third of the West Bengal's 294 Assembly constituencies.

READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Counting of votes for West Bengal election begins
details.content: Counting of votes for West Bengal Assembly Elections and four other states begins.

details.title: Here is what Exit Polls predicted for Bengal
Poll campaign rallies lead to sharp rise in COVID-19 cases
details.content: West Bengal is witnessing a steep rise in COVID-19 cases and fatalities, and many health experts held month-long political extravaganzas responsible for the spread of the coronavirus in urban as well as rural regions of the state.

details.title: Counting visuals from Bengal
details.content:
Counting of votes for #WestBengalPolls is underway. Visuals from a counting centre in Haldia of East Midnapore where votes in Haldia, Mahishadal and Nandigram are being counted.

TMC leader and CM Mamata Banerjee had contested against BJP's Suvendu Adhikari from Nandigram. pic.twitter.com/Z7T7mJhw7E

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: Counting agent hospitalised in Bengal
details.content: Gopal Som, a counting agent of Congress candidate from Panihati (North 24 Parganas), Tapas Majumder, was taken to a hospital after he fell unconscious at the counting centre.

details.title: Neck and neck battle in Bengal
details.content:
Early leads show BJP and TMC chasing each other. 

While BJP is leading on 64 seats, TMC is ahead on 66 seats.

details.title: Early trends show TMC, BJP locked in neck-and-neck tussle
details.content: The TMC and challenger BJP were Sunday locked in a neck-and-neck contest in West Bengal as counting of postal ballots was underway, with the ruling party having a slight edge, officials said.

details.title: The Left combine is leading in three places
details.content: The Left-Congress-ISF candidates are leading in three places.

details.title: TMC leading on 3 seats, according to EC trends
Didi trailing in key constitiency: Nandigram
details.content: After the first round, TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee is trailing by 1,497 votes in the Nandigram constituency. Nandigram in Purba Medinipur district of Bengal will decide the fate of two heavyweights -- BJP's Suvendu Adhikari and TMC's Mamata Banerjee. Nandigram seat has a special place in Bengal’s politics as Mamata launched her biggest political movement here against the Left government in 2007.

details.title: Babul Supriyo trailing by 4500 votes in Tollygunge seat
details.content: BJP MP Babul Supriyo is trailing by 4500 votes in the Tollygunge constituency in Kolkata.

details.title: CM Mamata Banerjee trailing at the end of second round in Nandigram
details.content: After the second round, Mamata Banerjee is trailing by 3,460 votes in Nandigram.

details.title: TMC leading by over 4000 votes in Singur assembly constituency
details.content: In the Singur assembly constituency of Hooghly district, the TMC is leading by 4466 votes. In the 2019 Lok Sabha polls, BJP secured over 10000 votes from these seats

details.title: Mamata trailing in Nandigram after round 3 of voting
details.content: After the third round, Mamata is trailing by 8,206 votes in Nandigram. There are 14 rounds left to be counted.

details.title: Madan Mitra leading from Kamarhati
details.content: Official trends show TMC's Madan Mitra leading from Kamarhati.

details.title: TMC's Aroop Biswas leading over his BJP rival Babul Supriyo in Tollygunge
details.content:
Official trends | TMC's Aroop Biswas leading from Tollyganj, BJP's Babul Supriyo trailing. #WestBengalPolls

(File photo) pic.twitter.com/i6kMPkK8XR

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: Latest updates from Bengal correspondent
details.content:
• BJP's Swapan Dasgupta is trailing by 1886 votes after second round in Tarakeshwar AC, Hooghly.
  • After third round, Mamata is trailing by 8,206 votes in Nandigram. There are 14 rounds left to be counted.
  • TMC leading in 189 and BJP in 98.
  • LF-CONG-ISF alliance in 5 seats.

details.title: BJP leading in Sitakulchi, TMC in Junglemahal
details.content:
• In Sitalkuchi Assembly Constituency, where four persons were gunned down by the central force, BJP is leading by 953 votes after the first round.
  • In Dalit dominated Junglemahal where BJP performed impressively in 2019 LS polls, TMC is leading in 16 assembly seats out of 27

details.title: TMC candidates leading
details.content:
• TMC candidate Becharam Manna leading in Singur, according to initial trends.
  • TMC candidates Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay & Firhad Hakim leading from Bhabanipur & Kolkata Port seats respectively, according to initial trends.

details.title: We will cross magic number: BJP's Vijayvarigiya
details.content:
Too early to say anything because there are so many rounds. Situation will be clear only by evening. We had started from 3 & were challenged that we won't get even 100, we have crossed that mark. We will cross the magic number too: Kailash Vijayvargiya, BJP#WestBengalPolls pic.twitter.com/ZS5LmrGcNF

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: TMC leading in over 18 seats: EC
BJP's Suvendu Adhikari continues to lead from Nandigram
details.content:
Official trends | Suvendu Adhikari, BJP candidate from Nandigram continues to lead from the Assembly constituency. #WestBengalElections2021 pic.twitter.com/bmMRFFfHFt

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: Bhabhanipur constituency
details.content:
TMC's Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay leading from Bhabanipur constituency.

For Chattopadhyay, who had fought assembly elections seven times and won each of the contests, the constituency is his home turf as he is a resident of the area and exercises his franchise there.

details.title: TMC workers defy EC ban, celebrate party leads in Asansol
details.content:
#WATCH | Celebrations by TMC supporters begin in Asansol as official trends show the party leading on 202 seats so far. The Election Commission has banned any victory procession amid the #COVID19 situation in the country.#WestBengalElections2021 pic.twitter.com/2sEtXI7mF6

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: EC fumes over parties taking out victory rallies
details.content: ECI takes serious note of reports coming in of congregation(s) of people to celebrate anticipated victory. EC has directed Chief Secretaries of all 5 states to file FIR in each such case, suspend concerned SHO and report action taken immediately of each such incidence: ECI

details.title: Primary task of new TMC govt will be to put health system back on track: Firhad Hakim
details.content: Asserting that the TMC will storm back to power in West Bengal, senior party leader and outgoing urban development minister Firhad Hakim on Sunday said the primary task of the new government would be to put the state's "derailed health system back on track", amid the relentless surge in COVID-19 cases.

details.title: Mehbooba Mufti congratulates CM Mamata
details.content:
Congratulations to @MamataOfficial @AITCofficial @derekobrienmp
on their splendid victory today. Kudos to the people of West Bengal for rejecting disruptive & divisive forces.

— Mehbooba Mufti (@MehboobaMufti) May 2, 2021

details.title: People of Bengal gave befitting reply to repeated attacks on Mamata: Partha Chatterjee on poll trends
details.content: "We have always talked about unity and development... and the way the CM had worked for the welfare of people by risking her life amid the pandemic, has reflected in the election results," TMC general secretary said.

details.title: TMC workers gather outside BJP office in Kolkata
details.content:
#WATCH Trinamool Congress supporters in large numbers gathered outside the BJP office in Kolkata's Hastings area, as TMC leads in 200 plus seats #WestBengalElections pic.twitter.com/KywRZVoq2v

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: 'Mandate has given TMC workers energy'
details.content: We really don't want to celebrate but there was an anti-campaign against TMC. Our workers were under pressure. This mandate has given them energy. Still, we're telling them not to celebrate due to COVID situation: Sayan Deb Chatterjee, State Secretary, WB Trinamool Youth Congress

details.title: CM Arvind Kejriwal congratulates Didi for landslide victory
details.content:
Congratulations @MamataOfficial didi for landslide victory. What a fight!

Congratulations to the people of WB

— Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) May 2, 2021

details.title: JNU student wing president Aishe Ghosh loses to TMC nominee
details.content: JNU's student wing president Aishe Ghosh has been defeated by TMC candidate in Jamuria AC.

details.title: Mamata Banerjee is leading by over 3000 votes
details.content: After 14th round of couting of votes, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee is leading by 3,132 votes.

details.title: Mamata Banerjee trailing by 6 votes
details.content: After 16th round, Mamata Banerjee is trailing by 6 votes in Nandigram.

details.title: 'Quitting this space', declares Prashant Kishor
details.content:
"I am quitting this space," Kishor told a mediahouse after trends showed a landslide victory for the TMC, the party whose election strategy he helped craft for the assembly elections.

details.title: Defence minister Rajnath Singh congratulates CM Mamata
details.content:
Congratulations to the Chief Minister of West Bengal, @MamataOfficial Didi on her party’s victory in West Bengal assembly elections. My best wishes to her for her next tenure.

— Rajnath Singh (@rajnathsingh) May 2, 2021

details.title: WATCH | Election Live with Experts: How were Bengal, TN, Kerala, Assam and Puducherry won?
'Bangla nijer meye kei chaaye': Mamata Banerjee wins Nandigram
details.content: Banerjee defeated her arch-rival Suvendu Adhikari with a thin margin of 1,200 votes as the much-anticipated 'battle of Nandigram' concluded.

details.title: Wishes pour in for Didi on TMC's resounding victory
details.content:
Congratulations @MamataOfficial didi on @AITCofficial being elected again in the Assembly election. Good wishes for your next tenure.

— Nirmala Sitharaman (@nsitharaman) May 2, 2021

details.title: Top priority to battle COVID surge: Didi
details.content: "For us, combating the COVID-19 situation will be the topmost priority. This is victory of Bengal and only Bengal can do it," she said in her brief message to party workers.

details.title: TMC won despite PM Modi, ministers campaigning: Uddhav Thackeray
details.content: In a statement, Thackeray said Banerjee led the fight for Bengal's self-respect single-handedly, adding that "all credit goes to the Bengal tigress for the win". (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 'Please do not speculate': Mamata Banerjee on Nandigram vote count
details.content:
The counting process for Nandigram has not been completed. Please do not speculate.

— All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial) May 2, 2021

details.title: No victory rally for TMC in view of COVID crisis
details.content: No grand oath-taking ceremony to be organised; mega victory rally in Kolkata when pandemic is over: CM Mamata Banerjee

details.title: WATCH | Election Results: How Bengal's 'daughter' Mamata Banerjee defeated Modi, Shah
PM Modi congratulates CM Mamata Banerjee on TMC's victory
details.content:
Congratulations to Mamata Didi for Trinamool Congress' win in West Bengal. The Centre will continue to extend all possible support to the West Bengal Government to fulfil people’s aspirations and also to overcome the COVID-19 pandemic: PM Narendra Modi

(File photo) pic.twitter.com/YdY9qpyT8s

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: Victory signs for 'Banglaar meye'
U-turn for TMC in Nandigram? Suvendu Adhikari thanks Nandigram voters after 'win'
details.content:
My sincere thanks to the great People of Nandigram for their love, trust, blessings, and support, and for choosing me as their representative and the MLA from #Nandigram. It is my never-ending commitment to be of service to them and working for their welfare. I am truly grateful! pic.twitter.com/oQyeYswDa8

details.title: West Bengal Governor wishes Mamata Banerjee on TMC's Bengal victory
details.content: Tomorrow at 7.00 PM, the chief minister will be calling on me at Raj Bhawan, says Governor of West Bengal Jagdeep Dhankhar

details.title: TMC asks for recount in Nandigram after BJP's Suvendu defeats Mamata Banerjee
details.content:
Three-member Trinamool Congress delegation is meeting Chief Electoral Officer at EC Office in Kolkata seeking a recount of votes in Nandigram and other issues

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: In letter to Bengal Chief Electoral Officer, TMC asks for 'immediate recounting in Nandigram'
details.content:
Trinamool Congress writes to Chief Electoral office, West Bengal for, "immediate re-counting of votes in Nandigram AC 210 and postal ballots." pic.twitter.com/BKCpdzrMf2

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: Nandigram: In round 16, Mamata Banerjee's lead significantly reduced
Left Front, Congress fail to win any seats in Bengal Assembly
details.content:
• For the first time since 1947, the Left front and the Congress failed to secure even a single seat in West Bengal.
  • In the 2016 state assembly elections, Left Front won 26 seats while Congress 44 seats.
  • Tally of both the parties has come down to zero.
  • With this loss, the Left Front has no representative in Lok Sabha and state Assembly.

(Inputs from ENS)

details.title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari wins the Nandigram seat by 1956 votes
Aishe Ghosh trails in the third place in Jamuria
details.content:
• Former Jawaharlal Nehru University Students Union (JNUSU) president Aishe Ghosh, who contested on CPI(M) candidate from West Bengal's Jamuria assembly seat bagged only 24,818 votes to emerge third.
  • Trinamool Congress' Hareram Singh, who won the seat bagging 71,002 votes to outsmart BJP's Tapas Kumar Roy by a margin of 8,051 to emerge winner.
  • Incidentally, the 26-year-old Ghosh was given the ticket by the CPI(M) over sitting MLA Jahanara Khan.
